trans-unit.source: Use Mobile Services to upload images to blob storage (Android) | Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Use Mobile Services to upload images to blob storage (Android) | Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to upload images to Azure Storage and access the images from your Android app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to upload images to Azure Storage and access the images from your Android app.

trans-unit.source: Upload images to Azure Storage from an Android device
trans-unit.target: Upload images to Azure Storage from an Android device

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to enable your Android Azure Mobile Services app to upload images to Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to enable your Android Azure Mobile Services app to upload images to Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.

trans-unit.source: However, it's more efficient to store binary large object (BLOB) data in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: However, it's more efficient to store binary large object (BLOB) data in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you enable the Mobile Services quickstart app to take pictures with the Android camera, and upload the images to Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you enable the Mobile Services quickstart app to take pictures with the Android camera, and upload the images to Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: What you need to get started
trans-unit.target: What you need to get started

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the Mobile Services quickstart: [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the Mobile Services quickstart: [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial also requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial also requires the following:

trans-unit.source: An [Azure Storage account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md)
trans-unit.target: An [Azure Storage account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md)

trans-unit.source: An Android device with a camera
trans-unit.target: An Android device with a camera

trans-unit.source: How the app works
trans-unit.target: How the app works

trans-unit.source: Uploading the photo image is a multistep process:
trans-unit.target: Uploading the photo image is a multistep process:

trans-unit.source: First you take a photo, and insert a TodoItem row into the SQL database that contains new meta-data fields used by Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: First you take a photo, and insert a TodoItem row into the SQL database that contains new meta-data fields used by Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: A new mobile service SQL **insert** script asks Azure Storage for a Shared Access Signature (SAS).
trans-unit.target: A new mobile service SQL **insert** script asks Azure Storage for a Shared Access Signature (SAS).

trans-unit.source: That script returns the SAS and a URI for the blob to the client.
trans-unit.target: That script returns the SAS and a URI for the blob to the client.

trans-unit.source: The client uploads the photo, using the SAS and blob URI.
trans-unit.target: The client uploads the photo, using the SAS and blob URI.

trans-unit.source: So what is a SAS?
trans-unit.target: So what is a SAS?

trans-unit.source: It's not safe to store the credentials needed to upload data to the Azure Storage service inside your client app.
trans-unit.target: It's not safe to store the credentials needed to upload data to the Azure Storage service inside your client app.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you store these credentials in your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that grants permission to upload a new image.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you store these credentials in your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that grants permission to upload a new image.

trans-unit.source: The SAS, a credential with a 5 minute expiration, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.
trans-unit.target: The SAS, a credential with a 5 minute expiration, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.

trans-unit.source: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.
trans-unit.target: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Shared Access Signatures, Part 1: Understanding the SAS Model](../storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-1.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Shared Access Signatures, Part 1: Understanding the SAS Model](../storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-1.md)

trans-unit.source: Code Sample
trans-unit.target: Code Sample

trans-unit.source: [Here](https://github.com/Azure/mobile-services-samples/tree/master/UploadImages) is the completed client source code part of this app.
trans-unit.target: [Here](https://github.com/Azure/mobile-services-samples/tree/master/UploadImages) is the completed client source code part of this app.

trans-unit.source: To run it you must complete the Mobile Services backend parts of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: To run it you must complete the Mobile Services backend parts of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Update the registered insert script in the Azure classic portal
trans-unit.target: Update the registered insert script in the Azure classic portal

trans-unit.source: Update the quickstart app to capture and upload images.
trans-unit.target: Update the quickstart app to capture and upload images.

trans-unit.target: Reference the Azure Storage Android client library

trans-unit.target: To add the reference to the library, in the **app** > **build.gradle** file, add this line to the `dependencies` section:

trans-unit.source: Change the `minSdkVersion` value to 15 (required by the camera API).
trans-unit.target: Change the `minSdkVersion` value to 15 (required by the camera API).

trans-unit.source: Press the **Sync Project with Gradle Files** icon.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Sync Project with Gradle Files** icon.

trans-unit.source: Update the manifest file for camera and storage
trans-unit.target: Update the manifest file for camera and storage

trans-unit.source: Specify your app requires having a camera available by adding this line to **AndroidManifest.xml**:
trans-unit.target: Specify your app requires having a camera available by adding this line to **AndroidManifest.xml**:

trans-unit.target: Specify your app needs permission to write to external storage by adding this line to **AndroidManifest.xml**:

trans-unit.source: Note that Android external storage is not necessarily an SD card: for more see [Saving Files](http://developer.android.com/training/basics/data-storage/files.html).
trans-unit.target: Note that Android external storage is not necessarily an SD card: for more see [Saving Files](http://developer.android.com/training/basics/data-storage/files.html).

trans-unit.target: Update resource files for the new user interface

trans-unit.target: Add code for photo capture

trans-unit.source: In **ToDoActivity.java** add this code to create a **File** object with a unique name.
trans-unit.target: In **ToDoActivity.java** add this code to create a **File** object with a unique name.

trans-unit.source: Add this code to start the Android camera app.
trans-unit.target: Add this code to start the Android camera app.

trans-unit.source: You can then take pictures, and when one looks OK, press **Save**, which will store it in the file you just created.
trans-unit.target: You can then take pictures, and when one looks OK, press **Save**, which will store it in the file you just created.

trans-unit.source: Add code to upload photo file to blob storage
trans-unit.target: Add code to upload photo file to blob storage

trans-unit.source: First we add some new meta-data fields to the `ToDoItem` object by adding this code to **ToDoItem.java**.
trans-unit.target: First we add some new meta-data fields to the `ToDoItem` object by adding this code to **ToDoItem.java**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the 0-parameter constructor with this code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the 0-parameter constructor with this code:

trans-unit.source: Replace the multi-parameter constructor with this code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the multi-parameter constructor with this code:

trans-unit.source: In the **ToDoActivity.java** file, replace the **addItem** method in **ToDoActivity.java** with the following code that uploads the image.
trans-unit.target: In the **ToDoActivity.java** file, replace the **addItem** method in **ToDoActivity.java** with the following code that uploads the image.

trans-unit.source: This code sends a request to the mobile service to insert a new TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: This code sends a request to the mobile service to insert a new TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: The response contains the SAS, which is then used to upload the image from local storage to a blob in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The response contains the SAS, which is then used to upload the image from local storage to a blob in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Test uploading the images
trans-unit.target: Test uploading the images

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio press **Run**.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio press **Run**.

trans-unit.source: In the dialogue, choose the device to use.
trans-unit.target: In the dialogue, choose the device to use.

trans-unit.source: When the app UI appears, enter text in the textbox labeled **Add a ToDo item**.
trans-unit.target: When the app UI appears, enter text in the textbox labeled **Add a ToDo item**.

trans-unit.source: Press **Take Photo**.
trans-unit.target: Press **Take Photo**.

trans-unit.source: When the camera app starts, take a photo.
trans-unit.target: When the camera app starts, take a photo.

trans-unit.source: Press the check mark to accept the photo.
trans-unit.target: Press the check mark to accept the photo.

trans-unit.source: Press **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: Press **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: Note how the ToDoItem has been added to the list, as usual.
trans-unit.target: Note how the ToDoItem has been added to the list, as usual.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure classic portal, go to your storage account and press the **Containers** tab, and press the name of your container in the list.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure classic portal, go to your storage account and press the **Containers** tab, and press the name of your container in the list.

trans-unit.source: A list of your uploaded blob files will appear.
trans-unit.target: A list of your uploaded blob files will appear.

trans-unit.source: Select one and press **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Select one and press **Download**.

trans-unit.source: The image that you uploaded now appears in a browser window.
trans-unit.target: The image that you uploaded now appears in a browser window.
